segments.text: CNN has decided not to run a Donald Trump-endorsed campaign ad after the network decided it does not meet their standards.
segments.speaker: SPEAKER_00

segments.text: The 30-second advertisement paid for by Trump's campaign targeted Joe Biden's conduct toward Ukraine while he served as vice president, while also referring to CNN personalities Don Lemon, Chris Cuomo and Jim Acosta as media lapdogs.
segments.speaker: SPEAKER_00

segments.text: A CNN spokesperson spoke to THR saying the ad does not meet the network's advertising standards, adding, In addition to disparaging CNN and its journalists, the ad makes assertions that have been proven demonstrably false by various news outlets including CNN.
segments.speaker: SPEAKER_00

segments.text: However, despite CNN's rejection, the president posted the advertisement onto his Twitter page last week along with the caption, Now this is not the first time CNN has rejected a Trump campaign ad.
segments.speaker: SPEAKER_00

segments.text: Back in 2017, the network refused to run a Trump-approved ad called, Which criticized the media and specifically called out Lemon as well as Anderson Cooper.
segments.speaker: SPEAKER_00

segments.text: To stay up to date on this story, head to THR.com and until next time, for The Hollywood Reporter News, I'm Neha Joy.
segments.speaker: SPEAKER_00
